nodes.documentation:
notice acquire the main lock of a database
 dev event will go off if the lock is already obtained
 param {DB} storage _db - reference to database in dbs array
nodes.name: _acquireDB

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Database was not locked and was attempted to be unlocked"

arguments.value: Database was not locked and was attempted to be unlocked

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Database was not locked and was attempted to be unlocked"

nodes.documentation:
notice release the main lock of a database
 dev event will go off if the lock was not locked, but was attempted to be unlocked (always an error state)
 param {DB} storage _db - reference to database in dbs array
nodes.name: _releaseDB

nodes.documentation:
notice add a newly created database to the dbs array in an open slot of the existing length or append
 dev support to _createDB
 param {uint} uint _uid - generated unique ID for database
 param {string} memory _name - provided name of database
 param {address} _setOwner - address of who will own the database
 return {uint}- index of available slot (zero if none across dbs length are avail)
nodes.name: _addToDBS

nodes.documentation:
notice create a database and add it to the dbs array
 dev support createDB
 param {uint} _uid - generated unique ID for database
 param {string} memory _name - provided name of database
 param {address} _setOwner - address of who will own the database
nodes.name: _createDB

nodes.documentation:
notice generate unique id for database by hashing provided database name
 dev provide _createDB w/ uid to support createDB
 param {string} memory _dbName - name of database
 return {uint} - 256-bit uid
nodes.name: _generateUniqueID

typeDescriptions.typeString: struct Exchain.DB storage ref[] storage ref
struct Exchain.DB storage ref[] storage ref

nodes.documentation:
notice check if the name is already used as a database name. No duplicate names bc of hashing to make uid.
 dev support createDB
 param {string} memory _name - intended name of database
 return {bool} - is the name already in use
nodes.name: _isNameInUse

nodes.documentation:
notice create a slot for a database
 dev only head entity that deploys smart contract can execute. Note: head entity may create their own database.
 param {string} memory _name - intended name of database
 param {address} _setOwner- intended owner of the database
 return {uint}- uid of database
nodes.name: createDB

nodes.documentation:
notice delete an existing database

 param {uint} _uid - unique 265-bit ID of database to be deleted
nodes.name: deleteDB

nodes.documentation:
notice check if cooldown is complete
 param {DB} storage _db - reference to database in dbs array
 return {bool} - has cooldown expired
nodes.name: _isReady

nodes.documentation:
notice prevent continuous writes by not allowing writing during a cooldown time
 param {DB} storage _db- reference to database in dbs array
nodes.name: _triggerCooldown

nodes.documentation:
notice modify an owned database
 dev uses sync
 param {string} memory _data - string of data attempting to add
nodes.name: writeDB

nodes.documentation:
notice read an existing database contents
 dev uses sync
 param {uint} _uid - unique 265-bit ID you want to read
 return {string} memory - Database's contents

isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the current owner to relinquish control of the contract.

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

createDB(string,address).notice: notice create a slot for a database dev only head entity that deploys smart contract can execute. Note: head entity may create their own database. param {string} memory _name - intended name of database param {address} _setOwner- intended owner of the database return {uint}- uid of database

deleteDB(uint256).notice: notice delete an existing database dev only head entity that deploys smart contract can execute. Note: head entity may delete their own database. param {uint} _uid - unique 265-bit ID of database to be deleted

readDB(uint256).notice: notice read an existing database contents dev uses sync param {uint} _uid - unique 265-bit ID you want to read return {string} memory - Database's contents

renounceOwnership().notice: Renouncing to ownership will leave the contract without an owner. It will not be possible to call the functions with the `onlyOwner` modifier anymore.

writeDB(string).notice: notice modify an owned database dev uses sync param {string} memory _data - string of data attempting to add
